verses.kjv: Knowest thou the time when the wild goats of the rock bring forth? or canst thou mark when the hinds do calve?
verses.ct: Do you know when mountain goats give birth? Can you observe the moment deer deliver their young?

verses.kjv: Canst thou number the months that they fulfil? or knowest thou the time when they bring forth?
verses.ct: Can you count the months of their pregnancy? Do you know the exact time they give birth?

verses.kjv: They bow themselves, they bring forth their young ones, they cast out their sorrows.
verses.ct: They crouch down, deliver their offspring, and their labor pains come to an end.

verses.kjv: Their young ones are in good liking, they grow up with corn; they go forth, and return not unto them.
verses.ct: Their young grow strong and thrive in the open fields; they leave and never come back to their mothers.

verses.kjv: Who hath sent out the wild ass free? or who hath loosed the bands of the wild ass?
verses.ct: Who set the wild donkey free? Who released it from all restraints?

verses.kjv: Whose house I have made the wilderness, and the barren land his dwellings.
verses.ct: I gave it the desert as its home and the salt flats as its dwelling place.

verses.kjv: He scorneth the multitude of the city, neither regardeth he the crying of the driver.
verses.ct: It laughs at the noise of the city and never has to hear a driver's shouts.

verses.kjv: The range of the mountains is his pasture, and he searcheth after every green thing.
verses.ct: It roams the mountains as its pasture, searching for every bit of green vegetation.

verses.kjv: Will the unicorn be willing to serve thee, or abide by thy crib?
verses.ct: Will the wild ox agree to serve you, or spend the night at your feeding trough?

verses.kjv: Canst thou bind the unicorn with his band in the furrow? or will he harrow the valleys after thee?
verses.ct: Can you harness the wild ox to plow a furrow? Will it work the fields behind you?

verses.kjv: Wilt thou trust him, because his strength is great? or wilt thou leave thy labour to him?
verses.ct: Will you rely on it just because it has enormous strength? Would you trust it with your heavy labor?

verses.kjv: Wilt thou believe him, that he will bring home thy seed, and gather it into thy barn?
verses.ct: Can you count on it to bring in your grain and gather your harvest to the threshing floor?

verses.kjv: Gavest thou the goodly wings unto the peacocks? or wings and feathers unto the ostrich?
verses.ct: The wings of the ostrich flap joyfully, but they are not like the graceful wings and feathers of the stork.

verses.kjv: Which leaveth her eggs in the earth, and warmeth them in dust,
verses.ct: She leaves her eggs on the ground and lets the warmth of the dirt incubate them.

verses.kjv: And forgetteth that the foot may crush them, or that the wild beast may break them.
verses.ct: She doesn't consider that a foot might crush them or a wild animal might trample them.

verses.kjv: She is hardened against her young ones, as though they were not hers: her labour is in vain without fear;
verses.ct: She treats her young harshly, as if they weren't even hers. She doesn't care that her effort might be wasted.

verses.kjv: Because God hath deprived her of wisdom, neither hath he imparted to her understanding.
verses.ct: This is because God did not give her wisdom or grant her any share of understanding.

verses.kjv: What time she lifteth up herself on high, she scorneth the horse and his rider.
verses.ct: Yet when she rises up and runs at full speed, she outpaces the horse and its rider.

verses.kjv: Hast thou given the horse strength? hast thou clothed his neck with thunder?
verses.ct: Did you give the horse its strength? Did you drape its neck with a flowing mane?

verses.kjv: Canst thou make him afraid as a grasshopper? the glory of his nostrils is terrible.
verses.ct: Can you make it leap like a locust? Its powerful snorting is terrifying.

verses.kjv: He paweth in the valley, and rejoiceth in his strength: he goeth on to meet the armed men.
verses.ct: It paws the ground in the valley, thrilled by its own power, and charges out to meet armed warriors.

verses.kjv: He mocketh at fear, and is not affrighted; neither turneth he back from the sword.
verses.ct: It laughs at danger and feels no terror; it does not retreat from the sword.

verses.kjv: The quiver rattleth against him, the glittering spear and the shield.
verses.ct: Arrows rattle against its side, along with the flash of spears and javelins.

verses.kjv: He swalloweth the ground with fierceness and rage: neither believeth he that it is the sound of the trumpet.
verses.ct: Trembling with excitement and fury, it devours the distance. When the trumpet sounds, it cannot stand still.

verses.kjv: He saith among the trumpets, Ha, ha; and he smelleth the battle afar off, the thunder of the captains, and the shouting.
verses.ct: At each blast of the trumpet it snorts, 'Yes!' It catches the scent of battle from far away â€” the roar of commanders and the war cries.

verses.kjv: Doth the hawk fly by thy wisdom, and stretch her wings toward the south?
verses.ct: Does the hawk soar because of your wisdom? Does it spread its wings toward the south by your instruction?

verses.kjv: Doth the eagle mount up at thy command, and make her nest on high?
verses.ct: Does the eagle rise high at your command and build its nest in the heights?

verses.kjv: She dwelleth and abideth on the rock, upon the crag of the rock, and the strong place.
verses.ct: It lives and makes its home on the cliff face, perched on rocky crags and fortress-like ledges.

verses.kjv: From thence she seeketh the prey, and her eyes behold afar off.
verses.ct: From there it hunts for food, and its eyes spot prey from an enormous distance.

verses.kjv: Her young ones also suck up blood: and where the slain are, there is she.
verses.ct: Its young ones feast on blood, and wherever the dead are found, there the eagle will be.
